macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US S&P 500 Falls 1.12% to 6898 on February 3 Amid Tech Selloff
items.summary: The US500 index dropped 1.12% to 6898 points on February 3, 2026, with large-cap growth stocks down ~2% while value and small caps outperformed. This follows a rally on February 2 where S&P 500 rose ~0.5% and Dow ~1% on strong ISM Manufacturing data.

items.title: Dow Jones Opens 0.09% Higher on February 3 Led by Merck and JPMorgan
items.summary: The Dow Jones gained 43 points or 0.09% early on February 3, driven by Merck (+3.53%), JPMorgan (+2.06%), and Coca-Cola (+1.79%), while IBM (-5.19%), Salesforce (-4.60%), and Nvidia (-2.00%) lagged. US equities inched higher overall on optimistic tech earnings.

items.title: NYSE Reports S&P 500 Down ~1.5% on February 3 as Growth Stocks Decline
items.summary: Major US indices faded after a strong open on February 3, with S&P 500 down ~1.5%, large-cap growth -2%, amid news of Anthropic's AI plug-ins update hitting software stocks. Energy and consumer staples led gains on oil bounce and geopolitical calm.

items.title: Indian Nifty 50 and Sensex Open Lower on February 4
items.summary: Indian markets opened in red on February 4, 2026, with Nifty 50 down 0.20% at 25,675 and Sensex down 0.58%, amid mixed global signals following strong prior session gains.

items.title: US Shoots Down Iranian Drone; Venezuela Oil License Rumors Boost Energy
items.summary: Geopolitical tensions eased as US downed an Iranian drone near USS Abraham Lincoln without major oil price impact; reports of US planning general licenses for Venezuelan oil pumping supported energy sector reversal.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Tumbles 2.4% in 24 Hours, Down 14.5% Weekly
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading at $76,619, down 2.4% over the past 24 hours and 14.5% over the past week. The decline is driven by liquidated dip-buyer positions, ETF outflows since November, and reduced expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts.

items.title: Ethereum Drops 4% in 24 Hours, Down 54% From August 2025 Peak
items.summary: Ethereum is trading at $2,258, down 4% in the past 24 hours, 29.2% in the past month, and 54.1% since reaching all-time highs on August 22, 2025.

items.title: $638 Million in Token Unlocks Expected in Early February 2026
items.summary: Major projects including Hyperliquid (HYPE), XDC Network (XDC), and Berachain (BERA) will unlock over $638 million in tokens during the first week of February, with potential for market volatility.

items.title: Vitalik Buterin Sells 1,441 ETH Worth $3.3 Million for Donation Plan
items.summary: Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin has sold 1,441 ETH over the past two days as part of a previously announced multi-year donation plan to support open-source software and hardware development.

items.title: Large ETH Transfer to Binance Signals Leverage Reduction
items.summary: TrendResearch transferred 15,000 ETH (approximately $33.08 million) to Binance, bringing its total transfers to 153,588 ETH ($352.43 million) as part of a leverage reduction strategy.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Researchers Develop Data-Driven Method to Define Operational Limits for AI Systems
items.summary: A novel AI-based method retrospectively defines operational design domains (ODDs) for complex systems using kernel-based affinity representations, validated on Monte Carlo simulations and aviation collision-avoidance scenarios. The approach is deterministic, interpretable, and works with sparse data for certification and monitoring.

items.title: AI Supercharges AWS Attack Chain: Credentials to Cloud Admin in 8 Minutes
items.summary: Sysdig reports threat actors used LLMs to rapidly escalate from exposed S3 credentials to full AWS admin control, including LLMjacking Bedrock models and launching costly GPU instances for ML workloads. The November 2025 incident highlights AI-accelerated cloud attacks collapsing detection windows.

items.title: Emotion AI Market Projected to Reach $15.57 Billion by 2030
items.summary: The emotion artificial intelligence market is expected to grow from $4.71 billion in 2025 to $5.99 billion in 2026 at a 27.2% CAGR, driven by customer analytics, biometric sensors, and applications in healthcare and security. Key trends include multimodal sensing and deep learning advances.

items.title: Study Compares LLM Word Perceptions to Human Cognition
items.summary: New research in Behavior Research Methods examines how large language models mirror human ratings of word attributes like concreteness and imageability, finding strong correlations for some but discrepancies for prepositions. LLMs show biases in predicting word acquisition age.

items.title: Microsoft's Kevin Scott: AI Outpacing Use Cases Amid Code Review and Compute Limits
items.summary: At a Microsoft conference, CTO Kevin Scott stated AI development is advancing faster than practical use cases, constrained by code review processes and compute shortages.

items.title: SMU Launches Master of Science in Business AI Program
items.summary: Singapore Management University introduced a new MSc in Business AI to train leaders in translating AI into business strategy, addressing the skills gap in strategic AI deployment and risk management.

items.title: AIMPLAS POLY-ML Project Uses AI to Predict Plastic Material Properties
items.summary: Funded by IVACE+i, the POLY-ML initiative employs AI from Tyris AI to forecast plastic properties using data from FAPERIN's automotive injection molding processes.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Diablo Immortal Announces New PvP Game Mode and Events Starting February 4
items.summary: Diablo Immortal introduces a new PvP mode with dynamic blessings dropping every 90 seconds, running from February 4-23, offering double battleground rewards. Tangi's Renewal event also returns from February 4-26 with tasks for rewards.[1]

items.title: Rivals II Launches Primal Dawn Monthly Event with New Skins
items.summary: Aether Studios releases the Primal Dawn event in Rivals II from February 3 to March 3, featuring a free event track for cosmetics, coins, and bucks, plus a paid bundle with epic Primal Maypul skin and others.[2]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Nintendo Shares Plunge Over 10% Despite Strong Profits on Switch 2 Concerns
items.summary: Nintendo's stock dropped more than 10% after reporting strong profits, as investors worry about sustaining sales momentum for the Switch 2 console launched last year. This occurred amid mixed Asia shares following U.S. tech stock losses.

items.title: Big Tech Stocks Drag Wall Street Lower with S&P 500 Down 0.8%
items.summary: U.S. markets fell Tuesday led by losses in Big Tech, with the S&P 500 dropping 0.8%, Nasdaq 1.4%, and information technology sector down 2.2%. Microsoft and Nvidia each lost nearly 3%, amid concerns over valuations.

items.title: Software Stocks Slump 5.7% in Worst Day in 10 Months
items.summary: The State Street SPDR S&P Software & Services ETF fell 5.7%, marking its worst performance in about 10 months, contributing to broader tech sector weakness. This pulled down major indices including the Dow Jones by 0.3%.

items.title: OnlyFans in Talks to Sell 60% Stake for $3.5B Valuation
items.summary: OnlyFans is negotiating exclusively with Architect Capital to sell a majority stake at a $3.5B valuation (enterprise value $5.5B), aiming for expansion and a potential 2028 IPO. The creator platform seeks a U.S. buyer amid growth plans.
